intro: Phyllostylon rhamnoides, commonly known as the broadleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive leaf structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has alternate, simple leaves that are often heart-shaped. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its adaptability, it can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
